===Etymology===
{{IPAchar|/tani/}} → {{IPAchar|/dani/}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=たに'}}. Shift from earlier reading ''tani''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> This reading persists in some modern dialects.

The kanji spelling is unrelated to the reading, and appears to be a case of [[semantic]] [[ateji]] or [[jukujikun]]. The characters literally mean {{m|ja|壁||wall}} + {{m|ja|蝨||louse}}, possibly as an indication that ticks and mites may be found on walls.
